Authors:
Ekaterina Malysheva, Vera F. Malysheva, Tatiana Yu.
Svetasheva
Title:
Molecular phylogeny and taxonomic revision of the genus
Bolbitius (Bolbitiaceae, Agaricales) in Russia
Abstract:
The 6 species recorded from Russia in the genus Bolbitius
were studied. Among them B. bisporus and B. pallidus are described as
new in the paper. Comprehensive descriptions of all species,
illustrations, photographs and comparisons with similar taxa are
provided. Phylogenetic analyses were conducted to aid of taxa
delimitation as well as identification of species boundaries in the
genus Bolbitius. Molecular phylogenetic reconstructions inferred from
maximum likelihood and Bayesian analyses were based on combined
datasets: nrITS-nrLSU for the whole set of studied species and
nrITS-tef1-mtSSU for B. titubans specimens. The molecular data of three
genetic markers indicate the existence at least three divergent lineages
in the B. titubans, each may represent a phylogenetic species or
independent taxonomic unit. This suggests that B. titubans likely is a
species complex rather than one widely distributed taxon.
